lenders.name: HUWIB
lenders.loan_because: The Harvard Undergraduate Women In Business club is hosting its annual Intercollegiate Business Convention. The convention's mission is to bring together undergraduate women with an interest in business to share ideas, build business skills, and meet industry leaders. Many women come out of IBC with not only a host of new friends from different schools and universities, but also valuable business connections to help them find internships and post-college jobs! This year we have decided to donate some of the  ticket profits to KIVA. We hope to promote female entrepreneurship all over the world.
lenders.occupational_info: HUWIB is currently the largest undergraduate business organization on campus at Harvard, reaching over 300 members. The organization seeks to empower a dynamic group of enterprising young women by uniting them through business education and experience. Through panels, conferences, outreach initiatives, skill-building workshops, leadership projects, and mentorship programs, HUWIB seeks to expose undergraduate women to a variety of business careers.

lenders.name: Solomon Onyango
lenders.loan_because:
I do believe it is important to disclose that I was once employed and my terms were void of any pension able benefit. At the time of my employment, I had a very cordial relationship with my bankers but when I did present this current proposal, they declined as my account was not performing consistently as before and to make it worse they kindly requested a tangible security to accompany it. 
sincerely,
lenders.occupational_info:
Hi,
My name is Solomon Onyango. I am a Kenyan citizen working for an electronic money transfer company.
This is a service accorded by a local mobile service company to serve its clientele by enabling them to remit money to friends and relatives through text instructions. This is made possible through the company's appointed agents all over the country who receive and pay funds on demand.
As an administrator of a local agent in my locality called KATITO, it has come to my realization that it’s strenuous for an agent to provide money services cum top-up call cards hence my interest to supply the locals with top up cards.
I have two boys who are through with schooling and would like to engage them in distribution of these top-up cards by way of bicycles which is the local mode of transport.
The area to be covered is on a 20 km radius and encompasses the environ of people settled around the lake. The essence is that local fishermen log on the internet to check  the prevailing market prices as to keep abreast with knowledge of bargaining so as not to be exploited by the middlemen roaming the beaches.
 
The bone of contention is affordability of these top up cards! Mobile service providers have various denominations at the disposal of their subscribers and the affordable, cheapest denomination comes in kshs 50 and kshs 20. By conversion, 1 dollar equals kshs 65 at current going rate.
Internet connectivity provided by the mobile operators is affordable and a credit top up of kshs 20 can accord one 20 minutes of browsing.
 
My main focus is to set up a supply chain to the locals of top-up cards of denominations of 50 and 20 with a daily supply of 3500 cards reaching all. This will be in breakdowns of 1000 cards in 50 denominator and 2500 cards in 20 denominators.
 
The 3500 purchase is meant to reach 48 outlets everyday by quick access with bicycles. It is important to note that the main economic activities comprise fishing at the Lake Victoria , cattle trade, cross border complimentary business and peasant subsistence farming.
 
 To factor on viability of my project, I would tabulate as follows:
                Card of kshs 50 = 2.50 commission
                Card of kshs 20 = 1.00 commission
Hence;
                1000 cards of kshs 50 = 100 * 2.50 = 2500
                2500 cards of kshs 20 = 2000 * 1 = 2000
                                                      Total    = 4500
 
I hereby do approach KIVA as an organization to solicit for me 2000 dollars to help me start up this noble idea in conjunction with my jobless sons
I was introduced to yourselves by Mr. Martin Opondo who is a community worker with AMREF  KENYA (REF: opondoobwar@gmail.com)

lenders.name: MAGDI
lenders.loan_because:
Hi

My name is Magdi Bunt and I am living in South Africa.
I have been working as an instructor and an educator for the past 8 years. I am currently
tutoring kids in my small place and making them more able to learn. In Africa education
is quite a problem and I am teaching people to read and write properly. I am a dedicated
and this is what I would like to do in my life. 
I would like to open and rent out a larger premises where I can have the opportunity to
teach and tutor more kids and people at the same time. At the moment I do not have
enough funds to rent out a larger space and I would like to loan money for this.
Currently I am tutoring from home where I can fit 4 people in my very small dining area. 
I am 30 years old, happily married. And I have helped hundreds of kids and youth as well
parents to be literate and have given them an opportunity to live a better life by teaching
them how to read and write as well as raising their study abilities. 
I love what I am doing but I can’t manage to rent an office from my pay. 
I saw this wonderful opportunity on the Oprah show and I would like make use of this
opportunity because it will give me a good start to build up my “Dream” tutoring and
education centre here in this province or area.
I love to help people and I have dedicated my life to do this. However I would like to take
my small tutoring school to a higher level where more youth will have the opportunity to
get educated and find jobs. 
Please put me on your pages for loans. 

Best Regards, Magdi Bunt
lenders.occupational_info: I am Instructing children and youth with learning difficulties and make them more able and raise their study abilities.

I also enjoy using a portion of the Quote Couture profits to empower women entrepreneurs in Africa. I am a top 1% lender on Kiva.
Shop http://www.quote-couture.com so, together, we can have a greater positive impact on the world.

I am also the co-frounder of team Africa. We are 150+ members strong, and in the top 2% teams on Kiva. Join me there: http://www.kiva.org/team/africa.

lenders.name: Dan
lenders.loan_because:
I'm fortunate enough to have the ability set some money aside for this and the multiplier effect, from both financial and social perspectives, is huge.

It's also way too cool that repayments of previous loans, from people all over the world, can fund a new loan for someone else all by themselves.  I think it's just awesome that an initial downpayment of loans can set off a continuous cycle that allows people to grow their businesses, support their families and, in the meantime, enable someone else on the other end of the earth to do the same, just by paying the loan back.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm getting a graduate degree in social entrepreneurship - learning how to use business skills and tools to make a difference in the world.

lenders.occupational_info: I work in the entertainment industry as a producer
